Sajib Dasgupta wrote:
> Hi,
> I am using heritrix-1.14.0-RC1 on Windows.
> I can't add the regular expression with the characters like ('/', '~' 
> etc.) 
> 
> My goal is very simple:
> ==========================
> I want to crawl either the seed or deeper webpages with certain 
> pattern (.*program.*). 
> Given the seed of http://www.hlt.utdallas.edu/~sajib/, I have added 
> the following rules in the crawl-order scope:
> 
>   Reject By Default org.archive.crawler.deciderules.RejectDecideRule
>   Accept If org.archive.crawler.deciderules.MatchesRegExpDecideRule 
>                  [Here, I have added the seed as regular expression]
>   Accept If org.archive.crawler.deciderules.MatchesRegExpDecideRule 
>                  [Here, I have added .*program.* as regular expression]

You have no rules here to accept the necessary prerequisite URLs 
Heritrix needs to visit before even visiting your seed. So you should 
add at least a PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule at the end.

Still, while your seed would then match the 2nd rule's regex (exactly), 
I don't see any outlinks on your seed page that have 'program' in them. 
So nothing else would be crawled.

Maybe you want to crawl everything 'under' (an extension of) 
http://www.hlt.utdallas.edu/~sajib/ ? In which case make that second 
rule a SurtPrefixedDecideRule, with ACCEPT as the decision, and have it 
use the seeds to get the initial acceptable prefixes.

That will get your seed, plus any other material it discovers at URLs 
starting http://www.hlt.utdallas.edu/~sajib/ -- and any 'program' URLs 
if you leave in your third rule.

I highly recommend people designing their own scopes start with the 
default and craft it to add/remove other URLs, rather than build up from 
scratch.

- Gordon @ IA

> 
> I also tried with
>   Reject By Default org.archive.crawler.deciderules.RejectDecideRule
>   Accept If org.archive.crawler.deciderules.MatchesRegExpDecideRule 
>                  [Here, I have added .*program.* as regular expression]
>   Accept If org.archive.crawler.deciderules.SeedAcceptDecideRule
> 
> None of those seems to work. 
> I thing if anyone suggests how to write the regular expression in 
> Heritrix, that would be just great.
> 
> Thanks,
> Sajib
>
